messages.heading: Four Steps to Svelte
messages.one_tutorial: Svelte tutorial* is an official guide that helps you ‘learn by doing’ — get hands-on with Svelte and SvelteKit concepts from basic to advanced through small exercises.
messages.one_tutorial_footnote: * this is a guide for Svelte 5 and currently only supports English
messages.one_playground: Svelte playground* (REPL) is an official interactive editor that helps you quickly test ideas or observe the output from the Svelte compiler.
messages.one_lab: SvelteLab is an advanced interactive editor built by the community, extending ideas from Svelte playground, supporting SvelteKit and many features for a complete project.
messages.two_docs: Svelte documentation is the official catalogue for features and public interfaces of Svelte and SvelteKit, organized in a comprehensive and searchable manner - the first-stop reference in your daily work with Svelte.
messages.three_description: Start having conversations, help or seek help from other members
messages.three_github: Contribute to the project on Github
messages.three_note: You can also follow news about events from Svelte Vietnam or articles from the Svelte Vietnam Blog.
messages.four_heading: Get news from the international Svelte community
messages.four_svelte: Svelte is an open-source project. Follow and contribute to the development of Svelte through the following channels.
messages.four_society: Svelte society is a volunteer global network connecting Svelte enthusiasts. Svelte Society oversees many important resources for the community.
messages.four_summit: Svelte Summit is an international conference event about Svelte, gathering maintainers and speakers from all around the world.
messages.four_hack: SvelteHack is a hackathon event that usually takes place after important milestones in the Svelte ecosystem.
